reviewTitle: "Noise ColorFit Pulse 3: Stylish and Feature-Packed Smartwatch at an Affordable Price"
reviewDescription: The Noise ColorFit Pulse 3 is an impressive addition to the realm of budget-friendly smartwatches. It stands out with its sleek design and vibrant display, making it both stylish and functional. The touchscreen is bright and responsive, ensuring a clear view even in direct sunlight.One of the standout features is its comprehensive health tracking capabilities. The watch offers accurate heart rate monitoring, blood oxygen level tracking, and sleep analysis. These features are particularly valuable for those who are keen on maintaining their well-being and tracking their fitness goals.In terms of battery life, the ColorFit Pulse 3 performs admirably, lasting up to 7 days on a single charge, which is a significant advantage for those who prefer minimal charging interruptions. The watch also supports multiple sports modes, providing detailed insights into various workouts, from running to yoga.The Noise ColorFit Pulse 3 integrates seamlessly with both Android and iOS devices, offering notifications for calls, messages, and apps directly on your wrist. This ensures that you stay connected without having to constantly check your phone.Overall, the Noise ColorFit Pulse 3 offers excellent value for its price. It combines style, functionality, and robust health tracking features, making it a great choice for anyone looking for a reliable smartwatch without breaking the bank.
Watch is good but watch me game nai hai üòÄ aur to aachi he hai but delivery late hai
Nice product
Good nice to see ‚ò∫Ô∏è quality is good

Update after almost a couple of months of usage:The replacement never made it to me and was marked as "Refused by Addressee" for no rhyme or reason.Some issues we have faced:The watch switches off on its own. It happened with the 2nd unit as well so seems like a device fault at worst or a design flaw at the most basic level.Design/crown placement is odd as it can get pressed when you flex your wrist. Since the crown controls the power on/off function, you can accidentally switch it off and not realize it. Been there done that and now wear it a couple of centimeters above the wrist to prevent the same.The screen is decently bright with no problems in bright sunlight as you can easily see what is on the screen. You will be better off with a screen guard applied as the glass can get scratched from the usual bumps and scrapes with the table or doors.Usability wise, of you have it on auto mode to measure your HR, O2 and Stress levels at regular intervals and BT pairing with the phone, the battery life will be about a day. More life can be derived if you switch off the auto mode.Watch faces can be changed thru the NoiseFit app and the pairing process is simple and straight forward. The app is more oriented towards increasing sales with ads for their products although it manages the fitness suite fairly decently, but of the watch gets switched off, you lose the progress when it gets synced again after powering it on.There are noise coins that can be collected based on you completing the goals set. The rewards are based on continuity of your active streaks and increase progressively on crossing set milestones.Overall, a very basic yet decent offering at an ok-ish pricepoint.Would I recommend buying this?It depends. I was looking for a smart watch to monitor my fitness goals on a very tight budget and this one fit the bill with all the bells and whistles like BT calling (utterly useless feature IMO) included, so it is a "Yes" from my end, provided you have the same criteria as mine. If you can afford to shell out some more money, by all means look at buying something else with a better design/layout.ORIGINAL REVIEW:Day 0: 02 Nos of product ordered at 8:00pm. Delivery happened the next day on time by 11:00 am. I wanted to pay using a CC but the delivery guy did not have a POS machine. Paid online.Day 1:Setup done easily. Worked as expected. Had an issue with battery drainage with 96% charge running out by 10pm in the night.Figured it could be due to the screen on time during the setup and the usual "exploration of a new gadget" thing due to which it may have drained out. Put on charge. Decent time taken to go to 100%The charger is the old style apple charger with magnetic points that have to be put in only one way to charge. The mag points repel the watch if polarity isn't proper.Day 2:The watch refused to power up. The screen remained blank and the phone would not connect with the watch thru the app.Replacement ordered. And now the time being taken to deliver the order is a week.Waiting for the replacement and will update once I have it up and running.The 2nd one is running just fine and working as expected. Will update on the standby time once I speak to my brother who also wanted to get one for himself.

reviewTitle: Noise ColorFit Pulse 3: Big Display, Big Letdown?
reviewDescription: The Noise ColorFit Pulse 3 boasts a large 1.96" display, but unfortunately, that's where the excitement might end for some users. Here's a closer look:Pros:Impressive Battery Life: The advertised 7-day battery backup seems to hold true, a major plus for those who hate constant charging.Excellent Call Quality: Both sides of calls come through clearly and loudly, making the built-in calling a valuable feature.Great Touch Sensitivity: The reviewer mentions smooth touch response, ensuring navigating the watch is a hassle-free experience.Seamless Notifications: Getting message alerts right on your wrist is a big convenience.Cons:Limited Watch Face Selection: The lack of attractive and user-friendly watch faces is a significant drawback. A watch is an accessory after all, and limited customization options can be a deal-breaker for some.Inaccurate Timekeeping Without Phone: The most concerning aspect is the watch's inability to maintain accurate time after two days without syncing to a phone. This defeats the purpose of having a watch if it can't function independently.Unreliable Raise-to-Wake: A malfunctioning raise-to-wake feature defeats the purpose of a quick glance at the time.Overall:The Noise ColorFit Pulse 3 offers a large display, impressive battery life, and clear calling, but these positives are overshadowed by the disappointing watch face selection and the critical issue of inaccurate timekeeping without a phone connection. The unreliable raise-to-wake feature adds to the frustration.Recommendation:If a large display, long battery life, and calling are your top priorities, the ColorFit Pulse 3 might be worth considering,  as long as you're willing to sync it daily and can live with the limited watch face options.  However, for users who value accurate timekeeping and a more customizable watch experience, it might be best to look elsewhere.
